action.primary: Tonifies the Kidneys and strengthens Yang

indications: Kidney Yang Deficiency with impotence, urinary incontinence, nocturnal emissions and irregular menstruation
Infertility from either a Cold Womb (women) or Cold Essence (men)
Obstinate Cold Damp Bi with generalized pain, a sense of weakness in the bones and sinews and lower back and knee pain (especially useful for Cold abdominal or lower back pain)

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with Excess Heat signs.
Do not use for a long time.
Do not store in an iron container.

useCases: Impotence, spermatorrhea and weakness and pain in the lower back and legs.
Accentuates the effects of the herb.
Chills and impotence with Cold sperm, cold extremities and infertility.
Damp-Cold induced pain and coldness in the lower back and legs.
Spleen and Kidney Yang Deficiency with epigastric fullness and pain, poor appetite and vomiting of clear fluids.
Feelings of weakness in the bones and sinews and/or lower back and knee pain.
Feelings of weakness in the bones and sinews and/or lower back and knee pain with Cold.

notes: Toxic reactions may be alleviated by taking a decoction of Rz. et Rx. Rhei #{DaHuang} Da Huang, Rz. Coptidis #{HuangLian} Huang Lian, and Rx. Scutellariae #{HuangQin} Huang Qin.
This is the main herb for cold Kidneys.
It is regarded as an aphrodisiac.
It can be taken as a single herb for urinary incontinence and frequent urination.
It governs Cold Qi in the epigastrium and abdomen with inability to eat, Wind-Cold causing cramps and spasms in the lower back and knees, Damp-consumption in men and incontinence in the elderly.
It reinforces sexual organ and assists sexual function in males.
It is said to tonify the San Jiao.

Xian Mao, Hb. Epimedii #{YinYangHuo} Yin Yang Huo, and Rx. Morindae #{BaJiTian} Ba Ji Tian all reinforce the Kidney Yang, strengthen the sinews and bones and expel Wind-Dampness. Xian Mao is the hottest and most acrid and strongly expels Cold-Dampness but its slight toxicity makes it appropriate only for short term use. Ba Ji Tian is acrid, sweet and only slightly warming with a soft, moistening quality that tonifies Yang without being overly dry or cloying. It also augment Jing. Yin Yang Huo is warmer and more markedly strengthens Ming Men Fire, while strongly dispersing Wind-Dampness and unblocking Bi.
Wine-fried Curculigo Jiu Chao Xian Mao is less harsh with an enhanced ability to tonify the Kidney Yang and strengthen sinews and bones.
